page.title: 09NEWS JUNE 1985 West Forres
page.content: Another interesting event in the news this week was the fact that a Scottish pilot Robbie Roberts was planning to fly upside down from Lossiemouth to Findhorn,a fifteen mile flight.Robbie will complete the flight on 29th June in aid of the newly formed Forres branch of the Save the Children Fund. The public have been warned to be on the look-out for forged fifty pound notes which may be circulating in the Moray area.A number of forged notes have been presented over the past few weeks mainly at licensed premises in the Elgin and Forres area. Drivers on the A96 on the western approaches to Forres were asked to exercise caution on the 27th June as Grampian Roads Depsrtment attempted to repair a section of the road which broke up the previous day following torrential rain.
